summary: despite successful eradication of smallpox by the WHO-led vaccination programme, pox virus infections remain a considerable health threat. the permissiveness of pox infections is independent of hosts surface receptors, but correlates with the ability of the virus to infiltrate the antiviral host response. the problem of emerging and re-emerging pathogens is likely to be one of the main issues of medical science and public health in the twenty-first century [1] despite remarkable progress in the control and treatment of infectious diseases, the problem of emerging and re-emerging pathogens is likely to be one of the main issues of medical science and public health in the twenty-first century. virus-host dynamics have been analysed by yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) studies. no closer look at the dynamic changes of the human proteome during a VACV infection has been taken yet on a global scale. a significantly advanced data quality was achieved by derivating the peptides on a solid phase support with 4-Sulfophenyl isothiocyanate. results PSD spectra of SPITC derivatized peptides improve protein identification efficiency Improved protein identification by combined Mascot search of the underivatised PMF. the peptide mass fingerprint of tryptic digested protein standard serum albumin (bovine) before and after derivatization is shown in Figure 2. Enhanced sensitivity of SPITC derivatization on solid phase support. many peptides could no longer be detected after derivatization. the intensity is normalised on the precursor ion of the underivatised PSD spectra. the improved coverage of the precursor ion y-series raised the Mascot Ion Score of the peptide with the mass of 1480.4 Da. the improved s/n ratio and increased signal intensity of the solid phase supported approach in PSD mode enlarges the coverage of the precursor ions' y-series and simplifies the automation of peak picking. the comparative Proteome Analysis of in Figure 2c and 2d. the overall signal of PMF spectra in the mass range between 1000 and 2500 m/z is about 7 times larger for the standard derivatised on C18 columns. the improved s/n ratio and the + - Q4PL71 Putative double-stranded RNA binding protein - vaccinia virus D-2 - - + P20642 major core protein P4a - 23kDa - vaccini the derivatization of peptides with SPITC binds a negatively charged sulfonic acid to the peptides' N-terminus. this negative charge neutralises the protonation of peptides which are no longer detectable in mass spectrometry. the derivatization with SPITC enables the detection of complete y-series with good s/n ratios. h post infection has enabled the identification of 24 human proteins. peptide sequences were derived from spectra of 13 spots representing proteins regulated in their expression. h post infection has enabled the identification of viral proteins. the resulting reduction equivalent NADH/H+ transfers electrons to the electron transport chain which builds up a proton gradient at the inner mitochondrial membrane. a modification of the -chain precursor of the H+-transporting two-sector ATPase (A-3, A-4), resulting in spot migration, is triggered by both types of infection. a modification of the -chain precursor of the H+-transporting two-sector ATPase (A-3, the spliceosome, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein B1 (B-5), heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein M (B-7) are modulated in both types of infected HEK2093 cells. a high FUBP1 expression increases the expression level of c-myc. both infectious and inactivated VACV IHD-W enhance the expression of FUBP1. mutations in the protein-expressing gene lead to the development of Ewing sarcomas. dsRNA activates the dsRNA-dependent serine/threonine kinase (PKR) which phosphorylates the -subunit of the translation initiation factor eIF-2 which is essential for protein biosynthesis. this phosphorylation inhibits the translation of mRNA and thereby induces apoptosis [30-33] prohibitin regulates cell division, inhibits DNA synthesis and sensibilises cells for apoptosis. infection of HEK293 cells with active and inactivated VACV IHD-W inhibits the expression of the protein Guanine nucleotide-binding protein subunit beta 2-like 1 (C-1) which is an acceptor for activated protein kinase C (PKC) the 14 kDa cell fusion protein (D-2) is identified in HEK293 cells infected with active and UV-inactivated VACV IHD-W. the protein expression is enhanced after infection of HEK293 cells with active and UV-inactivated VACV IHD-W. high concentrations of profilin inhibit the Actin-polymerization. both types of infection increase expression of profilin. VACV possesses a profilin homologue by itself. unambiguous mapping of peptides with completely known primary sequences to proteins registered in databases is remarkably simplified. however, the application of SPITC derivatization for protein identification from complex mixtures is limited by the reduction of the peptides' signal intensities following N-terminal sulfonation. the infection of HEK293 cells with active and inactivated Vaccinia Virus IHD-W significantly affects the cells' energy metabolism. the enhanced expression of the enzyme malate dehydrogenase (A-2) is directly associated with a boost in the energy metabolism, which serves the viruses' need for energy for DNA replication. all changes detected in the human proteome profile caused by the infection indicate an enhancement of the metabolic rate of the glycolysis as well as of the oxidative phosphorylation. the protein eIF-4H stimulates protein biosynthesis, ATP hydrolysis and helicase activity of eIF-4A. heterogeneous protein complex splices introns of the hnRNA. the protein is a known link between the apoptosis cascade and the c-myc oncogene. a high FUBP1 expression increases expression level of c-myc. the alterations caused by the infection are results of the fact that the virus is taking control of the cells' gene expression as well as the protein biosynthesis. this results in an altered expression profile of apoptosis-relevant genes caused by viral gene products. the presence of dsRNA activates the dsRNA-dependent serine/threonine kinase (PKR) which phosphorylates the -subunit of the translation initiation factor eIF-2 which is essential for hek 293 cells infected with active and inactivated VACV IHD-W inhibit the expression of the protein Guanine nucleotide-binding protein subunit beta 2-like 1 (C-1) which is an acceptor for activated protein kinase C (PKC) the reduced expression of the proteasome subunit alpha type-7-like (C-2) can be seen as a further cellular defence. the proteasome subunit alpha type-7-like (C-2) is part of the proteasome complex. it cleaves peptides proteolytically at the amino acids Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu and Glu. the phosphatidylethanolamine-binding protein (C-3, C-4) is modified by an infection with active and inactivated VACV IHD-W. nexin 3 (E-3) has a binding domain (PX domain) for phospholipids and transports proteins within cells from organelles to membranes. profilin (E-4) binds actin and participates in the build-up of the cytoskeleton. there is no difference between the identified alterations of the energy metabolism and just one differentially expressed protein associated with gene expression and protein biosynthesis (B-10) the modulation of apoptosis is clearly affected by effects that correlate with infectious viruses. the absence of nucleophosmin in cells infected with infectious viruses may be the response on viral dsRNA resulting from transcription of viral DNA. 4-sulfophenyl isothiocyanate (SPITC), biammonium citrate, bovine serum albumin (BSA), sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS), trypsin Profile IDG Kit and the ProteoSilver Plus Silver Stain Kit were bought from Sigma-Aldrich (Taufkirchen, Germany). TRIzol® Reagent was purchased from Invitrogen (Carlsbad, USA) proteomes of all three cell culture approaches were purified 9 h post infection. UV inactivation of VACV IHD-W Virus stock solution was centrifuged for 1 h at 21,000 g and 4°C. proteins were reduced for 15 min at 60°C with solution A (10 vol.-% 0.5 M Tris-HCl, pH 6.8, 6 M urea, 30 vol.-% glycerol, 140 mM SDS, 20 mM DDT) in the second dimension the proteins were separated in a 12-%-polyacrylamide gel (250 200 1 mm3) at 4 W, 600 V and 30 mA for 14 h at 12°C. mismatched spots representing differences in protein expression were manually checked and selected for mass spectrometric analysis. in-gel trypsination Differences in the protein expression profile were identified by using the image analysis software Melanie 7.0. thiol groups were carboxyamidomethylated by adding 6 l 1 M IAA at 25°C for 30 min in the dark. excessive iodoacetamide was converted with 1 l 2 M DTT at 60°C for 15 min before the proteolytic digest was induced by addition of 1 g trypsin. derivatised peptides were washed five times with 0.1% TFA and three times with 10 mM biammonium citrate prior to elution. 0.5 l matrix (10 mg CHCA in 1 ml ACN/0.1% TFA [1:1 v/v]) was added and the spot was air-dried. 100 profiles accumulated from ten laser shots were recorded in positive ion reflectron mode with a laser intensity of 4.0 J and a maximum laser-repetition rate of 5.0 Hz at a pulse extraction of 1500 m/z (delay-time). an external 5-points calibration was performed by using appropriate peptide standard (calibration Mix) 500-3500 Da [LaserBio Labs] prior to each measurement. fonate (CHAPS), a-cyano-4-hydroxycinnamic acid (CHCA), acetonitrile (ACN), trifluoroacetic acid (TFA), 4-sulfophenyl isothiocyanate (SPITC), biammonium citrate, bovine serum albumin (BSA), sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS), trypsin profile IDG kit and the ProteoSil proteomes of all three cell culture approaches were purified 9 h post infection. UV inactivation of VACV IHD-W Virus stock solution was centrifuged for 1 h at 21,000 g and 4°C. success of inactivation was checked by immunofluorescence staining of infected cells. proteins were reduced for 15 min at 60°C with solution A (10 vol.-% 0.5 M Tris-HCl, pH 6.8, 6 M urea, 30 vol.-% glycerol, 140 mM SDS, 20 mM DDT) in the second dimension the proteins were separated in a 12-%-polyacrylamide gel (250 200 1 mm3) for 14 h at 12°C in a horizontal system. the gel containing the best resolution and most spots was chosen as the master gel. the mismatched spots representing differences in protein expression were manually checked and selected for mass spectrometric analysis. thiol groups were carboxyamidomethylated by adding 6 l 1 M IAA at 60°C for 30 min in the dark. excessive iodoacetamide (IAA) was converted with 1 l 2 M DTT at 60°C for 15 min. derivatised peptides were washed five times with 0.1% TFA and three times with 10 mM biammonium citrate. 0.5 l matrix (10 mg CHCA in 1 ml ACN/0.1% TFA [1:1 v/v]) was added and the spot was air-dried. ten m/z values greater than 1200 were automatically selected with descending intensity by the Launchpad Software (Kratos Analytical) for post source decay (PSD) measurement. 100 profiles accumulated from ten laser shots were accumulated for one PSD spectrum which was recorded in positive ion reflectron mode with a laser intensity of 4.0 J. RB financed the analytical part of the study. AN conceived the study, and participated in its design.
